meanings.def: connected with a person’s mind and the way in which it works
examples: Abuse can lead to both psychological and emotional problems.
Her symptoms are more psychological than physical (= imaginary rather than real).
Victory in the last game gave them a psychological advantage over their opponents.
a psychological novel (= one that examines the minds of the characters)
Everyone has their own personal and psychological needs.
Her latest movie is a tense psychological drama.

meanings.def: connected with the study of psychology
examples: A psychological study of refugee children came up with some worrying results.

meanings.def: the best time to do something in order for it to be successful
examples: The trick is in finding the (right) psychological moment to ask him for more money.

idioms.def: the best time to do something in order for it to be successful
examples: The trick is in finding the (right) psychological moment to ask him for more money.
